meanings.definition: A group of people making a loud, confused noise.
meanings.sent1: The rabblers at the concert were shouting and cheering loudly.
meanings.sent2: The rabblers in the street protest were causing a commotion.
meanings.sent3: The rabblers at the party were having so much fun that they got a bit too loud.
meanings.sent4: The rabblers in the stadium sounded like a roaring thunderstorm.
meanings.sent5: The rabblers in the market created a chaotic atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A person who stirs up a crowd of people to cause trouble.
meanings.sent1: The rabblers were riling up the crowd with their provocative speeches.
meanings.sent2: The rabblers were instigating fights among the group.
meanings.sent3: The rabblers were causing mischief by encouraging others to misbehave.
meanings.sent4: The rabblers were like troublemakers leading the group astray.
meanings.sent5: The rabblers were inciting chaos with their disruptive behavior.

meanings.definition: A tool used for stirring or mixing liquids.
meanings.sent1: She used the rabblers to mix the ingredients in the bowl.
meanings.sent2: The chef grabbed the rabblers to blend the sauce smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The rabblers helped in stirring the soup to perfection.
meanings.sent4: With the rabblers, she combined the flavors effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The rabblers swirled the liquid into a delicious concoction.
